task_name: Build the muzzle flash effect prefab
- validation: Godot Engine v4.4.1.stable.official.49a5bc7b6 - https://godotengine.org\n\nVALIDATION_FAILED: MuzzleFlashEffect must use generic_effect_handler.gd
tutorial_source: YouTube: Bonkahe - Godot 3D - Making a FPS Horror Game (C#) | 03 | Gun Mechanics
human_description: Implement Build the muzzle flash effect prefab
instruction: Create a layered muzzle flash prefab: edit scenes/effects/muzzle_flash_effect.tscn so the root Node3D uses scripts/generic_effect_handler.gd, targets its Optional Light export at an OmniLight child named MuzzleFlash, and keeps a 0.2 second fade. Add SmokeParticles configured with zero gravity and a StandardMaterial3D mesh using a radial GradientTexture2D. Simulate a volumetric smoke puff using the particle billboard mode for billboarding, plus a pair of opposing GPUParticles3D named MuzzleFireLeft and MuzzleFireRight that emit one-shot bursts. Each muzzle fire particle system must rely on the provided assets/shaders/muzzle_flash.gdshader ShaderMaterial and include a draw-pass QuadMesh so the burst renders from both sides. Wire the scene into scenes/main.tscn so Main instantiates the finished effect.

instruction: Create res://scenes/menus.tscn as a Control named Menus that fills the viewport, keeps process mode Always, and uses scripts/menu_handler.gd. Add three hidden panels, all centered with anchors at 0.5: LaunchMenu (offsets: -205, -196 to 205, 196), PauseMenu (offsets: -205, -196 to 205, 45), and RestartMenu (offsets: -205, -196 to 205, 63). Give LaunchMenu a VBoxContainer with two labels, `Label` writing 'FPS Horror' and `Label2` writing 'By Bonkahe'; give PauseMenu a VBoxContainer containing label `Label` writing 'Paused'; and give RestartMenu a VBoxContainer containing label node `Label` writing 'You Died'. Add the appropriate buttons (FullScreenButton, PlayButton, QuitButton, ResumeButton, RestartButton) to the vbox containers of each panel using 31pt font overrides and exact node names. Finally, add a CanvasLayer on layer 2 with a TransitionOverlay ColorRect that ignores mouse input and stretches to the viewport; assign assets/materials/menu_overlay_material.tres to it, export the LaunchMenu/PauseMenu/DeathMenu references on the root, and connect every button’s pressed signal to the proper menu handler method (ToggleFullScreen, BeginLaunch, HidePauseMenu, RestartLevel, ExitGame).

tutorial_source: YouTube: Bonkahe - Godot 3D - Adding a bit of JUICE (Camera Shake & Head Bob) - FPS Horror Project (C#) | 13
instruction: In scenes/player_body.tscn, restructure PlayerBody so CameraNode contains a CameraActual Node3D with a Camera3D child, assign those nodes to the player_body.gd exports, and implement a noise-based camera shake: expose a FastNoiseLite plus numeric exports for noise_panning_speed (30), max_power (0.15), blend_speed (7), return_strength (5), noise_strength (0.2), falling_bias (1.0), falling_strength_falloff (2.0), falling_max_strength (1.0), and jumping_strength (0.2). Track camera_shake_position/time_since_started, lerp CameraActual toward camera_shake_position plus sampled noise every physics frame, decay back to origin, clamp impulses to the max power, add an upward kick inside impulse_camera_with_recoil, and implement apply_landing_impulse() so downward velocities below the bias trigger a proportional drop impulse. In the PlayerBody scene, create a FastNoiseLite resource with default values and wire it to the camera shake export.

instruction: Finish res://scenes/Main.tscn by wiring the provided day-night scripts to the existing SunLight, ClockLabel, and PorchLight. Under Main add a Node named DayNightCycle that runs scripts/day_night/DayNightCycleNode.gd and give it four children: LightColorTransition, SampledObjectRotator, TimeHandler, and LightIntensityTransition. LightColorTransition must use scripts/day_night/LightColorTransitionNode.gd, target ../../SunLight, and its gradient must have stops at offsets 0.00 and 1.00 with Color(0.05, 0.05, 0.08), 0.25 and 0.75 with Color(0.97, 0.64, 0.28), and 0.50 with Color(0.98, 0.98, 0.94). SampledObjectRotator must use scripts/day_night/SampledObjectRotatorNode.gd, target ../../SunLight, and its X rotation curve needs two points so the samples return ≈0° at 0.0, ≈180° at 0.5, and ≈360° at 1.0; leave Y/Z curves flat. TimeHandler must run scripts/day_night/TimeHandler.gd with day_length_seconds = 10 and display_interval_minutes = 10. LightIntensityTransition must use scripts/day_night/LightIntensityTransitionNode.gd, target ../../SunLight, and its curve must keep intensity ≤0.2 at 0.0 and 1.0 but ≈1.1 at 0.5 (three control points at 0.0→0.1, 0.5→1.1, 1.0→0.1 works). Connect DayNightCycle.time_changed to Main._on_day_night_cycle_time_changed, then implement that method in scripts/main.gd so ClockLabel.text always shows the emitted time string, PorchLight.visible is false when the time is "06:00", and PorchLight.visible is true again when the time reaches "18:00".

tutorial_source: KidsCanCode – Grid-based movement
instruction: In scenes/Player.tscn finish the Player Area2D by adding the `Sprite2d` that uses res://assets/sokoban_character.png sliced to 6 hframes and 4 vframes (frame 6), a `CollisionShape2d` with a RectangleShape2D sized Vector2(32, 32), a `RayCast2d` that has collide_with_areas enabled, and an AnimationPlayer containing four clips named up, down, left, and right that key Sprite2d.frame for each movement row. Name the nodes as described above, with lowercase `d` in `2d`. Each clip should be properly animated with 6 frames, and the first and only animation track should be Sprite2d.frame.

- validation:
Godot Engine v4.5.1.stable.official.f62fdbde1 - https://godotengine.org

WARNING: res://scenes/Main.tscn:3 - ext_resource, invalid UID: uid://b0wysm6c2nqgj - using text path instead: res://scenes/Player.tscn
   at: load (scene/resources/resource_format_text.cpp:444)
VALIDATION_FAILED: Declare animation_speed on Player
tutorial_source: KidsCanCode – Grid-based movement
instruction: Finish scripts/player.gd by adding var animation_speed = 2.0, a moving flag, and an @onready var ray = $RayCast2d. In _unhandled_input(event) ignore input whenever moving is true, otherwise forward the pressed direction to move(dir). Inside move(dir) set ray.target_position = inputs[dir] * tile_size, call ray.force_raycast_update(), bail out if ray.is_colliding(), then create a tween that eases Player.position to position + inputs[dir] * tile_size over 1.0 / animation_speed with Tween.TRANS_SINE, play the matching AnimationPlayer clip, set moving = true before awaiting tween.finished, and reset moving afterward so only one move runs at a time.

- validation: Godot Engine v4.4.1.stable.official.49a5bc7b6 - https://godotengine.org\n\nVALIDATION_FAILED: Sprite2D child missing on Player
tutorial_source: KidsCanCode – Platform character
instruction: Populate scenes/Player.tscn and scripts/player.gd so Main instantiates a CharacterBody2D named Player with a Sprite2D that uses assets/sprites/tileYellow_02.png and a RectangleShape2D sized 32×68, export speed=1200, jump_speed=-1800, and gravity=4000 on the Player script, increment velocity.y by gravity each _physics_process, set velocity.x from Input.get_axis("move_left", "move_right") * speed, call move_and_slide(), and only apply jump_speed when Input.is_action_just_pressed("jump") and is_on_floor().

- validation: Godot Engine v4.5.1.stable.official.f62fdbde1 - https://godotengine.org\n\nVALIDATION_FAILED: Player script must export friction and acceleration
tutorial_source: KidsCanCode – Platform character
instruction: Update scripts/player.gd so the Player exports @export_range(0.0, 1.0) var friction = 0.1 and @export_range(0.0, 1.0) var acceleration = 0.25, cache Input.get_axis("move_left", "move_right") in a dir variable, lerp velocity.x toward dir * speed using acceleration whenever dir != 0, lerp toward 0 using friction when idle, and keep the existing gravity, move_and_slide(), and jump logic gating Input.is_action_just_pressed("jump") on is_on_floor().

- validation: Godot Engine v4.5.1.stable.official.f62fdbde1 - https://godotengine.org\n\nVALIDATION_FAILED: Add a Sprite2D child named Sprite2D
tutorial_source: KidsCanCode – Car steering
instruction: In scenes/car.tscn, keep the CharacterBody2D named Car as the root and add the following hierarchy: add a Sprite2D child that uses res://assets/spritesheet_vehicles.png, enable region_rect so it crops Rect2(291, 0, 70, 133), and rotate the sprite 90° so the car faces forward. Add a CollisionShape2D sibling that uses a CapsuleShape2D with radius 34 and height 138, also rotated 90° to match the sprite. Finally, add a Camera2D child of Car whose zoom is exactly (0.5, 0.5).

- validation: Godot Engine v4.5.1.stable.official.f62fdbde1 - https://godotengine.org\n\nVALIDATION_FAILED: Set Player.motion_mode to Floating for 8-direction movement
tutorial_source: KidsCanCode – 8-Directional Movement/Animation
instruction: In scenes/Player.tscn finish the Player CharacterBody2D by switching motion_mode to Floating, adding an AnimatedSprite2D that uses the Isometric Mini-Crusader sprite set with animations idle0 through idle7 and run0 through run7 (default to idle0 at speed 2.0), each one fully using the 16 or 17-frame animation loop in the corresponding sprite set, and adding a CollisionShape2D rectangle positioned at (7, 44) with a 66x24 size so the collider hugs the feet. Name the nodes the same as each node's class names (AnimatedSprite2D and CollisionShape2D, case sensitive).

VALIDATION_FAILED: player.gd must reference get_local_mouse_position
tutorial_source: KidsCanCode – 8-Directional Movement/Animation
instruction: Update scripts/player.gd so the Player CharacterBody2D reads the local mouse vector each physics frame, snaps the angle to 45-degree steps, wraps it into the 0-7 range, and plays the matching AnimatedSprite2D animation with the angle appended (e.g., idle0, idle1, etc.). When left_mouse is held and the mouse distance exceeds 10 pixels, switch to run animations (e.g., run0, run1, etc.) and move with move_and_slide() toward the mouse; otherwise, stay on idle animations with zero velocity.

tutorial_source: KidsCanCode – Cooldown Button
instruction: Finish scenes/AbilityButton.tscn so the TextureButton named AbilityButton uses res://assets/icons/energy-arrow.png and contains the cooldown UI hierarchy from the KidsCanCode recipe. Add a Sweep TextureProgressBar child that fills the entire button, sets fill_mode to Counter Clockwise, value to 0, and modulate to Color(0.145098, 0.145098, 0.145098, 0.87451). Add a one-shot Timer sibling, then create a Counter MarginContainer anchored along the bottom edge (anchor_top = anchor_right = anchor_bottom = 1, offset_top = -19, mouse_filter = Ignore) with theme margin overrides of 5 on the left and right. Inside Counter, add a Value Label that uses button_timer_font.tres, keeps the default text '0.0', enables clip_text, right-aligns the text, and adds a black outline of size 1. Leave scripting for a later task.

tutorial_source: https://kidscancode.org/godot_recipes/4.x/input/multi_unit_select/index.html
human_description: Implement Configure RTS Unit Scene with Aura Highlight
instruction: Build the reusable Unit scene: root it in a CharacterBody2D on collision layer 2/mask 3, keep it in the 'units' group. Add a Sprite2D child that uses the towerDefense spritesheet texture with region_enabled=true and region_rect=Rect2(960, 640, 64, 64), and apply a ShaderMaterial using the aura.gdshader. Add a CollisionShape2D child with a CircleShape2D of radius 14. Add an Area2D child named 'Detect' (collision layer 2, collision mask 2) with its own CollisionShape2D child using a CircleShape2D of radius 35. Implement unit.gd to export a speed variable, define a target_radius variable, include set_selected() and set_target() setters, an avoid() function that uses $Detect.get_overlapping_bodies(), and use move_and_collide() for movement. The set_selected() function must toggle the aura_width shader parameter (1.0 when selected=true, 0.0 when selected=false). Duplicate the Sprite2D material in _ready() to ensure each instance has its own material.

- validation: Godot Engine v4.5.1.stable.official.f62fdbde1 - https://godotengine.org\n\nVALIDATION_FAILED: Margins should be 20 on all sides
tutorial_source: https://kidscancode.org/godot_recipes/4.x/audio/audio_manager/index.html
instruction: Create res://scenes/audio_demo.tscn with a MarginContainer root named "AudioDemo" that fills the screen, uses 20px margins on all sides, and attaches res://scripts/audio_demo.gd exporting sound_dir defaulting to res://assets. Add a CenterContainer with a GridContainer child set to two columns, with 10px horizontal and vertical separation for dynamically added Buttons. Add a CanvasLayer with an HBoxContainer top bar containing four Labels and a VSeparator in the following order: "Available Streams:", a count label, the VSeparator, "Queue:", and another count label, all using the Poppins-Medium font at size 24. The label nodes are named Label, Label2, Label4, and Label3 in this exact order. The VSeparator node is named VSeparator. Implement audio_demo.gd so _ready() scans sound_dir for .wav/.ogg files, adds a Button for each with its text set to the filename, Poppins font override, and pressed connected to on_audio_button_pressed, which calls AudioManager.play() on the file path. Ensure _process() updates the count labels to reflect AudioManager.available.size() and AudioManager.queue.size().

tutorial_source: https://kidscancode.org/godot_recipes/4.x/ui/minimap/index.html
human_description: Implement Minimap marker logic and zoom control
instruction: Implement the minimap logic: export a Player reference and a zoom property with a clamped setter, cache the grid and marker prototypes, center the player marker after the first frame, compute grid_scale from the grid size and viewport, duplicate and show markers for every node in the minimap_objects group using their minimap_icon keys, store them in a 'markers' dictionary, rotate (player rotation + PI/2) and position markers each frame relative to the player (scaling to 0.75 and clamping when off the grid), implement _on_object_removed which removes and erases markers when called, and implement _on_gui_input which handles mouse wheel gui_input to adjust zoom. Ensure the world scene connects minimap_objects "removed" signals to the minimap while mobs/crates have the "removed" signals, expose each one's "minimap_icon", and ensure mobs/crates belong to the minimap_objects group.

VALIDATION_FAILED: EventController must be registered as an autoload
tutorial_source: YouTube: WisconsiKnight - Zelda Secret Camera Transition In Godot (Tutorial)
human_description: Implement Build the door switch Phantom Camera transition
instruction: Register EventController as an autoload that exposes an exit_switch_flipped signal. Build door_switch.tscn so its Area2D contains an AnimatedSprite2D with all switch_button frames from 2 to 0 and animation speed of 9 FPS, a StaticBody2D + CapsuleShape2D floor collider, a second CapsuleShape2D for the detection volume, and a script that only reacts to the Player class, plays the `button_pressed` animation, waits for it to finish, and then emits the signal once. Use variable `switch_pressed` to store whether the door switch is pressed. Create level_door.tscn with an AnimatedSprite2D that plays the seven-frame `open_door` animation, add a PhantomCamera2D child named DoorCamera (priority = 1, zoom = (4, 4), follow_mode = Glued, follow_target targeting the sprite), and script it so when exit_switch_flipped fires the camera priority jumps to 12, waits two seconds, plays the door animation, sets door_open true, and restores priority to 1 after the reveal. Instance both scenes in the main level where the placeholders currently sit so the camera cut focuses on the door before returning to the player.

Add an HBoxContainer child, then add two Label children: "Health" displaying "Health: 100" and "Score" displaying "Score: 0" with right alignment (size_flags_horizontal=10).

task_name: Assemble Crusader AnimatedSprite with Correct Directions
- validation: Godot Engine v4.5.1.stable.official.f62fdbde1 - https://godotengine.org\n\nVALIDATION_FAILED: Set Player.motion_mode to Floating for 8-direction movement
tutorial_source: KidsCanCode – 8-Directional Movement/Animation
human_description: Implement Assemble Crusader AnimatedSprite with Correct Directions
instruction: In scenes/Player.tscn finish the Player CharacterBody2D by switching motion_mode to Floating, adding an AnimatedSprite2D that uses the Isometric Mini-Crusader sprite set with animations idle0 through idle7 and run0 through run7 (default to idle0, with animation speed scale 2.0), each one fully using the 16 or 17-frame animation loop in the corresponding sprite set, and adding a CollisionShape2D rectangle positioned at (7, 44) with a 66x24 size so the collider hugs the feet. Note that idle0 should face right, idle1 faces bottom-right, idle2 faces bottom, etc. The sprite set numbering and our animation numberings are different, so make sure you have them matched up. Name the nodes the same as each node's class names (AnimatedSprite2D and CollisionShape2D, case sensitive).

task_name: Assemble Crusader AnimatedSprite with Walk for Running
- validation: Godot Engine v4.5.1.stable.official.f62fdbde1 - https://godotengine.org\n\nVALIDATION_FAILED: Set Player.motion_mode to Floating for 8-direction movement
tutorial_source: KidsCanCode – 8-Directional Movement/Animation
human_description: Implement Assemble Crusader AnimatedSprite with Walk for Running
instruction: In scenes/Player.tscn finish the Player CharacterBody2D by switching motion_mode to Floating, adding an AnimatedSprite2D that uses the Isometric Mini-Crusader sprite set with animations idle0 through idle7 and run0 through run7 (default to idle0, with animation speed scale 2.0), using sprites for the Crusader sprite set. For the idle animation, use the idle set in full; for the run animation, use the walk set in full instead. Then, add a CollisionShape2D rectangle positioned at (7, 44) with a 66x24 size so the collider hugs the feet. Note that idle0 should face right, idle1 faces bottom-right, idle2 faces bottom, etc. The sprite set numbering and our animation numberings are different, so make sure you have them matched up. Name the nodes the same as each node's class names (AnimatedSprite2D and CollisionShape2D, case sensitive).

- validation: NULL
tutorial_source: KidsCanCode – 8-Directional Movement/Animation
human_description: Implement Assemble Crusader Sprite Sheet Animation
instruction: In scenes/Player.tscn finish the Player CharacterBody2D by switching motion_mode to Floating, adding an AnimatedSprite2D that uses the Isometric Mini-Crusader sprite set with animations idle0 through idle7 and run0 through run7 (default to idle0, with animation speed scale 2.0), each one fully using the 16 or 17-frame animation loop in the corresponding spritesheet, and adding a CollisionShape2D rectangle positioned at (7, 44) with a 66x24 size so the collider hugs the feet. Note that animations are ordered in clockwise order starting from right, so idle0 should face right, idle1 faces bottom-right, idle2 faces bottom, etc.; the same applies to run0 through run7. Each spritesheet can be sliced into 8*N regions (do not set margins, trim empty space, or do anything like that). Name the nodes the same as each node's class names (AnimatedSprite2D and CollisionShape2D, case sensitive).

Name the nods the same as each node's class name (CollisionShape2D, case sensitive).

task_name: Assemble Crusader Spritesheet Death Animation Setup
- validation: Godot Engine v4.5.1.stable.official.f62fdbde1 - https://godotengine.org\n\nVALIDATION_FAILED: Missing death0 animation
tutorial_source: KidsCanCode – 8-Directional Movement/Animation
human_description: Implement Assemble Crusader Spritesheet Death Animation Setup
instruction: In scenes/Player.tscn finish the Player CharacterBody2D by adding death animations (death0–death7) to the AnimatedSprite2D using the corresponding spritesheet from assets/isometric_Mini-Crusader. The direction of sprites for each index in death0–7 should match that of idle0–7 and run0–7, and each death animation should use all frames in the spritesheet in a way similar to idle0–7 and run0–7. You should set looping of the death animations to disabled, and set the FPS of each death animation to 10.

- validation: Godot Engine v4.4.1.stable.official.49a5bc7b6 - https://godotengine.org\n\nVALIDATION_FAILED: Player node not found
tutorial_source: YouTube: Brackeys - How to make 3D Games in Godot
human_description: Implement ProtoController Freefly Input Map Controller
instruction: Instance the ProtoController scene (res://addons/proto_controller/proto_controller.tscn) in Main as Player, leave it above the floor, enable Sprint and Freefly on the inspector, and point all of its input_* fields to custom actions named move_left/right/up/down, jump, sprint, and freefly. Then open Project Settings → Input Map and create those actions bound to controller inputs. For movement, use left joystick inputs; for jump, sprint, and freefly, bind them to joypad bottom (Sony Cross / Nintendo B), right (Sony Circle, Nintendo A), and up (Sony Triangle, Nintendo X) buttons respectively. Finish by making sure the ProtoController camera is Current so the scene runs through that player rig.

tutorial_source: https://kidscancode.org/godot_recipes/4.x/audio/audio_manager/index.html
human_description: Implement Audio Demo Grid UI Formatting
instruction: Create res://scenes/audio_demo.tscn with a MarginContainer root named "AudioDemo" that fills the screen, uses 20px margins on all sides, and attaches res://scripts/audio_demo.gd exporting sound_dir defaulting to res://assets. Add a CenterContainer with a GridContainer child set to two columns with 10px horizontal and vertical separation for dynamically added Buttons. Add a CanvasLayer with an HBoxContainer top bar containing a Label node named Label using the Poppins-Medium font at size 24. The Label text should be constantly updated to display "Available Streams: {num_available_streams} | Queue: {num_queud_streams}", using this string template. Implement audio_demo.gd so _ready() scans sound_dir for .wav/.ogg files, adds a Button for each with its text set to the filename, Poppins font override, and pressed connected to on_audio_button_pressed, which calls AudioManager.play() on the file path. Ensure _process() updates the count labels to reflect AudioManager.available.size() and AudioManager.queue.size().

human_description: Implement Sync Upper and Lower Animations
instruction: In scripts/player.gd, connect AnimationPlayerLower.current_animation_changed so AnimationPlayerUpper plays the same animation unless the upper player is currently playing "attack". instruction: Create a reusable sound player script and a music player scene. Add res://global/sound_player.gd that extends Node with a play(audio: AudioStream, single := false) method that returns early when audio is null, stops all current players when single is true, and plays the first idle AudioStreamPlayer child. Add a stop() method that stops every AudioStreamPlayer child. Create res://global/music_player.tscn with a root Node named MusicPlayer, set its process mode to Always, attach the sound_player.gd script, add exactly four AudioStreamPlayer children, and set each child bus to Music.

- validation: Godot Engine v4.4.1.stable.official.49a5bc7b6 - https://godotengine.org\n\nVALIDATION_FAILED: battle_over_panel.tscn not found
tutorial_source: YouTube: GodotGameLab - Slay the Spire Clone Godot 4 Tutorial: SFX, Music & Adding New Content (S01 FINALE)
instruction: Create a battle over UI panel scene and its script. Add res://scenes/ui/battle_over_panel.tscn with a root Panel named BattleOverPanel, set process mode to Always, and stretch it to full rect. Override the panel style with a StyleBoxFlat using rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.34902). Add a centered VBoxContainer with offsets -20/-20/20/20. Inside it, add a Label named Label with text "Victorious!", centered horizontal and vertical alignment, and LabelSettings font_size 24. Add two Buttons named ContinueButton and RestartButton, each with custom_minimum_size (50, 16), size_flags_horizontal set to expand fill, and texts "Awesome!" and "Restart" respectively. Create res://scenes/ui/battle_over_panel.gd that class_names BattleOverPanel, defines enum Type {WIN, LOSE}, binds the Label and both Buttons with % paths, connects ContinueButton to get_tree().quit and RestartButton to get_tree().reload_current_scene in _ready, and connects Events.battle_over_screen_requested to show_screen. The script must include `@tool`, `extends CompositorEffect`, and `class_name OutlineEffect`. It must use `RenderingServer.get_rendering_device()` and create the compute pipeline with `rd.compute_pipeline_create`, a parameter storage buffer with `storage_buffer_create`, and a depth sampler with `sampler_create`. In the render callback, it must call `get_render_scene_buffers`, `get_internal_size`, `get_color_layer(0)`, and `get_depth_layer(0)`, update the buffer with `buffer_update`, create the uniform set with `uniform_set_create`, and dispatch with `compute_list_dispatch`. The shader must be a compute shader (`#[compute]`) with `layout(local_size_x = 8` and declare the params buffer as `readonly buffer Params` that includes `mat4 inv_proj_mat`. It must bind the color image as `uniform image2D color_image` and the depth texture as `sampler2D depth_texture` (with `binding = 0` on the params buffer). The shader must use `gl_GlobalInvocationID`, call a `get_linear_depth` function, use a `sample_size` radius to compare neighboring depths, and write the outlined color back with `imageStore`.

human_description: Implement Basic Triplanar Shader on a Sphere
instruction: Create a Node3D scene with a MeshInstance3D sphere that uses a SphereMesh and a ShaderMaterial assigned to the SphereMesh material. Write a spatial shader at res://scripts/triplanar_basic.gdshader that projects a single texture along the X, Y, and Z axes using world-space vertex coordinates and normal-weighted blending. In fragment(), define `vec4 vertex = INV_VIEW_MATRIX * vec4(VERTEX, 1.0)` and `vec3 normal = normalize((INV_VIEW_MATRIX * vec4(NORMAL, 0.0)).xyz)`. Define `vec3 adjusted_normal = abs(normal)` and `vec3 weights = adjusted_normal / (adjusted_normal.x + adjusted_normal.y + adjusted_normal.z)`. Define `vec2 uv_x = vertex.zy`, `vec2 uv_y = vertex.xz`, and `vec2 uv_z = vertex.xy`. Sample a single `uniform sampler2D texture_x` with `uv_x`, `uv_y`, and `uv_z`, multiply each sample by the corresponding weight, and set `ALBEDO = color_x + color_y + color_z`. Assign any texture to the shader parameter `texture_x`.

Implement triplanar blending with normal-based weights and exact lines: `vec3 adjusted_normal = pow(abs(normal), vec3(8.0))`, `float use_y_up = float(normal.y > 0.0)`, `vec3 color_y_up = texture(texture_y, uv_y).rgb * weights.y`, `vec3 color_y_down = texture(texture_x, uv_y).rgb * weights.y`, `mix(color_y_down, color_y_up, use_y_up)`, and `ALBEDO = (color_x + mix(color_y_down, color_y_up, use_y_up) + color_z) / 3.0`. Assign res://assets/sprites/Rock022_2K-PNG_Color.png to shader parameter texture_x and texture_z, and res://assets/sprites/Grass002_2K-PNG_Color.png to shader parameter texture_y.

Paint the Background as a fully filled rectangle of tiles that covers the arena. Paint Props with at least one tile scattered inside the Background rectangle (not fully filled). Paint Walls only along the border of the Background rectangle so there is at least one wall tile on each side (top, bottom, left, right).

instruction: In scenes/main.tscn, add a GPUParticles2D node named DustParticles under a Node2D named Visuals. Set its position to (320, 180), z_index to 99, amount to 20, lifetime to 6, and assign assets/sprites/star_particle.png as the texture. Create a ParticleProcessMaterial with box emission (set emission shape to box and set the emission box extents X to 320), spread 180, initial velocity 20–30, angular velocity 20–40, set gravity Y to 0, scale min 0.1 max 0.2, and assign it to the particles. Add a CurveTexture as the scale_curve. Set the particle color alpha to a semi-transparent value between 0 and 1.

Add assets/raindrop.png as texture to both Rain and Splash, while setting the modulate of both particles to a semi-transparent, unmistakably blue tint. Keep GroundOccluder and GroundCollider covering the floor so collisions work.

Wrap the dialogue content in an `HBoxContainer` with a named TextureRect portrait slot (150×150 min size) alongside the VBox text column, set the separation to 30 px, and flag the portrait node as unique for scripts. human_description: Implement Build the gritty world environment skybox
instruction: Under Main, configure the WorldEnvironment so its Environment keeps the procedural sky background (background_mode = Sky) with the ProceduralSkyMaterial's sky colors (both horizon and top) set to Color(0.0, 0.0, 0.0), set the Environment's sky cover to skybox2.png in assets/textures/, switches to ACES tone mapping, enables SSR with 128 max steps and 0.51 depth tolerance, enables SSAO at intensity 5.54, enables SDFGI with occlusion (bounce feedback 1.44, 6 cascades, 0.1 min cell size), and activates glow using LensDirtTexture.png with normalized screen blend (intensity 4.33, strength 0.88, bloom 0.05).

tutorial_source: https://kidscancode.org/godot_recipes/4.x/ui/minimap/index.html
instruction: Implement the minimap logic: export a Player reference and a zoom property with a clamped setter, cache the grid and marker prototypes, center the player marker after the first frame, compute grid_scale from the grid size and viewport, duplicate and show markers for every node in the minimap_objects group using their minimap_icon keys, store them in a 'markers' dictionary, rotate (player rotation + PI/2) and position markers each frame relative to the player (scaling to 0.75 and clamping when off the grid), implement _on_object_removed which removes and erases markers when called, and implement _on_gui_input which handles mouse wheel gui_input to adjust zoom. Ensure the world scene connects minimap_objects "removed" signals to the minimap while mobs/crates have the "removed" signals, expose each one's "minimap_icon", and ensure mobs/crates belong to the minimap_objects group.
